IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: LEADING THE TRANSFORMATION OF PRIMARY CARE TO ACHIEVE HEALTH EQUALITY FOR ALL.
IRS990.MissionDesc: LEADING THE TRANSFORMATION OF PRIMARY CARE TO ACHIEVE HEALTH EQUITY FOR ALL.
IRS990.Desc: THE BUREAU OF PRIMARY HEALTH CARE PROVIDES HEALTH POLICY AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE SUPPORT TO COMMUNITY-BASED NON-PROFIT HEALTH CENTERS THAT PROVIDE PRIMARY HEALTH CARE TO LOW-INCOME OR UNINSURED RESIDENTS OF OREGON. IN ADDITION TO HEALTH POLICY EFFORTS, OPCA SERVICES TO HEALTH CENTERS INCLUDE ASSISTANCE WITH CLINICAL SERVICES, FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT, CLINIC ADMINISTRATION AND LEADERSHIP.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: OPCA PROVIDES DIRECT SUPPORT TO COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER MEMBERS ATTENDING CONFERENCES AND MEETINGS FOCUSED ON PRIMARY CARE MEDICAL HOME TRANSFORMATION, SUPPORT FOR POLICY EFFORTS TO EDUCATE STAKEHOLDERS ABOUT THE IMPORTANCE OF PAYMENT REFORM FOR PRIMARY CARE, AND OTHER CONSULTING SUPPORT FOR TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE IN CLINICAL QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. OPCA ALSO EDUCATES THE PUBLIC AND KEY STAKEHOLDERS ABOUT CRITICAL HEALTH CARE REFORM ISSUES THAT ARE OFTEN GIVEN LIMITED ATTENTION, PARTICULARLY REDUCING SYSTEMIC COSTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER NETWORK OF OREGON IS A CLINICALLY INTERGRATED NETWORK THAT SEEKS TO ADVANCE HEALTH EQUITY THROUGH THE OPERATION OF A NETWORK THAT CONTRACTS WITH COORDINATED CARE ORGANIZATIONS, HEALTH MAINTENANCE ORGANIZATIONS, PREFERRED PROVIDER ORGANIZATIONS, INSURANCE COMPANIES, EMPLOYERS, MANAGED CARE ORGANIZATIONS, AND OTHER THIRD-PARTY PAYORS UNDER VALUE-BASED PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

Form990PartVIISectionAGrp.TitleTxt: POLICY AND REGULATORY AFFAIRS SENIOR DIRECTOR

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:
Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.ExplanationTxt: MISCELLANEOUS REVENUE - 2018 AMOUNT: $ 16,434. 2019 AMOUNT: $ 45,893. 2020 AMOUNT: $ 4,033. 2021 AMOUNT: $ 0. 2022 AMOUNT: $ 0.

OtherAssetsOrgGrp.Desc: OPERATING LEASE RIGHT OF USE ASSET

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OPCA IS A NONPROFIT CORPORATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL AND STATE INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(C)(3) OF THE INTERNAL REVENUE CODE AND APPLICABLE STATE LAW. NO PROVISION FOR INCOME TAXES IS MADE IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AS OPCA DOES NOT CONDUCT ACTIVITIES SUBJECT TO UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAX. OPCA IS NOT A PRIVATE FOUNDATION. THE ORGANIZATION FOLLOWS THE PROVISIONS OF THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD (FASB) PER PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE ORGANIZATION'S TAX POSITIONS AND CONCLUDED THAT THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

PRIOR TO GIVING MONEY TO ANOTHER ORGANIZATION, OPCA ENSURES THE RECIPIENT IS A QUALIFIED CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION. FOLLOW-UP REPORTING IS UTILIZED TO EVALUATE ACTIONS TAKEN WITH THE FUNDS AND THE OUTCOMES OF THOSE ACTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS AN EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF THE BOARD'S OFFICERS, THE IMMEDIATE PAST PRESIDENT OF THE BOARD, AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AS AN EX-OFFICIO MEMBER. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE HAS THE AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD IN THE MANAGEMENT OF THE OPCA, BOARD WORK PROGRAMS, ANY PROJECTS OF BOARD COMMITTEES, AND TO TRANSACT BUSINESS BETWEEN REGULARLY SCHEDULED MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN KEEPING WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION, BYLAWS, AND ARTICLES OF INCORPORATION. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAKES RECOMMENDATION TO THE FULL BOARD REGARDING DECISIONS THAT HAVE A SIGNIFICANT IMPACT ON OPCA AND ITS MEMBERS. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE: (A) REVIEWS THE MISSION, VISION, AND VALUES FOR OPCA, AND SERVES AS AN ADVISORY COMMITTEE TO STRATEGIC PLANNING PROCESSES LED BY OPCA; (B) ADVISES OPCA REGARDING THE GOALS OF THE TRAINING AND TA PROGRAMS IN THE AREAS OF QUALITY, CLINIC MANAGEMENT, FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT AND LEADERSHIP; (C) REPORTS ALL BUSINESS TRANSACTED BY ITSELF TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AT THE BOARD'S NEXT MEETING; AND (D) ADDRESSES THE PROCESS OF SELECTION, REVIEW, AND DISMISSAL OF OPCA'S EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND, AS NECESSARY, GUIDES THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR IN DEVELOPING SOUND AND REALISTIC PERSONNEL PROGRAMS FOR THE OPCA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OPCA HIRED COMMUNITY LINK CONSULTANTS TO FILL AN INTERIM CFO ROLE. MISTY DILMORE AND ZACHARY MUELLER SERVED AS THE INTERIM CFO STARTING MAY 2022. COMMUNITY LINK CONSULTANTS WERE PAID $67,040 FOR THESE SERVICES IN THE 2022 CALENDAR YEAR.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OPCA HAS TWO MEMBERSHIP CATERORIES. THE FIRST CATEGORY CONSISTS OF BUREAU OF PRIMARY HEALTH CARE ("BPHC") 330-FUNDED FQHCS AND FEDERALLY DESIGNATED FQHC LOOK-ALIKES. THE SECOND CATEGORY, AFFILIATE MEMBERS, INCLUDES OTHER ORGANIZATIONS AND INDIVIDUALS INTERESTED OR INVOLVED IN THE PROMOTION OF PRIMARY CARE WHO SUPPORT OPCA THROUGH THE PAYMENT OF DUES. ALL FQHCS AND FQHC LOOK-ALIKES WHO HAVE PAID THEIR DUES HAVE ONE VOTE AND AFFILIATE BOARD MEMEBERS SITTING ON THE GOVERNING BOARD HAVE ONE VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE ELECTED BY A MAJORITY VOTE OF THE MEMBERS AT THE ANNUAL MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ANY BOARD MEMBER MAY BE REMOVED FROM OFFICE WITH OR WITHOUT CAUSE BY THE VOTE OF THE MEMBERS AT ANY SPECIAL MEETING CALLED FOR SUCH PURPOSE OR AT ANY REGULAR MEETING OF THE MEMBERS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 990 WAS REVIEWED BY THE EXCUTIVE DIRECTOR, THE FINANCE AND OPERATIONS SENIOR DIRECTOR, THE BOARD PRESIDENT, AND THE BOARD TREASURER PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: OPCA REQUIRES STAFF AND CANDIDATES FOR BOARD MEMEBERS TO ANNUALLY COMPLETE A DISCLOSURE OF INTEREST FORM. STAFF SHALL MAKE DISCLOSURES IN WRITING TO THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND/OR DESIGNATED EMPLOYEES WHILE THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR SHALL MAKE DISCLOSURES TO THE CHAIR OF THE BOARD WHO WILL, IN-TURN, BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ADVISING THE BOARD OF SUCH DISCLOSURES. DISCLOSURES MUST BE MADE AT THE AT THE DATE OF HIRE AND UPDATED ANNUALLY OR WITHIN SEVEN DAYS OF A STATUS CHANGE IN A STAFF MEMEBERS' INTEREST IN ORDER TO FACILITATE OPCA'S DETERMINATION AS TO WHETHER CONFLICT EXISTS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN OUTSIDE HR CONSULTANT MEETS WITH THE BOARD PRESIDENT TO REVIEW SALARY SURVEYS SHARING THE RESULTS WITH THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE EVALUATES THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND THE BOARD PRESIDENT SETS UP AND NEGOTIATES THE NEW CONTRACT. THE PROCESS WAS LAST COMPLETED IN 2018.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE MADE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST.
THE PROCESS FROM OVERSIGHT AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

DisregardedEntityName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: OREGON NETWORK OF COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTERS
